pageProps.content:
Experience

Lalibela Game Reserve is located within South Africa’s Eastern Cape province & although small in comparison with other South African reserves, it is the only one in the Eastern Cape without a public road running through its property.
The malaria-free Lalibela encompasses 5 eco-systems, resulting in a breathtaking diversity of fauna & flora. Home to the famous Big 5 – lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo & rhino – as well as other predators like cheetah, hyena, jackal & lynx – Lalibela never disappoints when it comes to wildlife viewing.
Lalibela Game Reserve places a strong focus on conservation, wildlife viewing, luxury & great food – the most important safari ingredients, by far!
With its accessible location (a 60-minute drive from Port Elizabeth), breathtaking scenery and Big 5 game viewing, Lalibela is the perfect safari add-on to a trip along South Africa’s world-famous Garden Route.

Activities

Lalibela Game Reserve offers a variety of exciting safari activities.
Guests visiting Lalibela can expect to see a variety of game during their time on safari. Twice daily game drives in open 4x4 vehicles will ensure excellent photographic opportunities & close wildlife encounters.
Daily walking safaris & animal tracking with expert-led guides will bring guests closer to nature.
Some of the family-friendly safari lodges include Kids Clubs that offer a bunch of exciting activities for the little ones, including special game drives, arts & crafts & African stories. These lodges also offer special child-friendly food & babysitting during adult dinner times & game drives.

When to travel

The best time to visit Lalibela is between October and March. Lalibela experiences a rainy season from June to early September, but it is still possible to visit during these months & have a great time on safari.

subfolders.title: Lalibela Kichaka Lodge
subfolders.description: Lalibela Game Reserve in the Eastern Cape consists of 7,500 hectares of land & is home to Africa’s Big 5 – lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo & rhino.   Only an hour away from Port Elizabeth & Addo Elephant Park, Lalibela is the perfect safari getaway for guests visiting the Garden Route on a self-drive holiday.

whatWeLoveItems: Excellent wildlife viewing, luxury lodges & superb food
Easily reached via self-drive – 60 minutes from Port Elizabeth
Combines easily with a Garden Route holiday
